committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to provide special allowances to certain physicians employed by the United States in order to enhance the recruitment and retention of such physicians.

summary.text: Federal Physicians Comparability Allowance Act - Entitles physicians employed by the Federal Government to a professional allowance in addition to basic pay. Authorizes Federal agencies to enter into service agreements with prospective government physicians whereby the physician is paid a bonus of up to $10,000 per annum in return for agreeing to work a specified number of years in such agency.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to provide special allowances to certain physicians employed by the United States in order to enhance the recruitment and retention of such physicians.
